data.title: Game with us.
data.text:
Application for Employment and/or Temporary/Agency Work (the âNoticeâ)

Relic Entertainment Inc. is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. We will treat your personal data confidentially and will comply with the Data Protection Act 2018, the UK General Data Protection Regulation and such other applicable legislation enacted from time to time relating to data privacy and protection (together, the âData Protection Legislationâ) in respect of our processing activities.

Relic is the data controller responsible for collecting and using your personal data.

By applying for employment at Relic, you agree to the processing by our applicant processing partner, Lever, Inc., (âLever â) of your personal data and you acknowledge that you have read and understood the following:

Information we collect from you

The types of personal data that we may collect directly from you include, but are not limited to, your first and last name, contact information, and career history data. Where you provide consent, we may also refer to information set out in your LinkedIn profile when considering your application.

You may be required to complete an assessment as you progress through the recruitment process. You will be provided with information about the assessment requirements in advance.

Pre-employment screening

We will always seek to limit the amount of personal data that we collect from you to what is required in accordance with applicable law and with your consent, in order to enable you to progress through the recruitment process.

How we use your information

As part of your application for temporary work and/or employment at Relic, the data you provide, and/or personal data provided on your behalf by one of our recruitment partners (such as a recruitment agency), including that from any interviews and assessments, will be held on our computers, the Lever platform, or manually in our files. The data will be used by Relic to process your application and ultimately, where your application is successful, so that Relic can make you an offer of temporary work and/or employment.

We do not use automated decision making as part of our recruitment process. All recruitment decisions for roles at Relic are made by the hiring manager and members of our recruitment team who assess your suitability for employment. We will send you the results of your application at the e-mail address that you have provided to Relic. Due to the high level of applications that we receive, we may not be able to provide individual feedback to unsuccessful candidates.

We take security very seriously and we use appropriate physical, technical and organizational security measures to help safeguard your personal data and protect against unauthorised access, accidental loss, destruction and/or damage.

Processing your information

Relic uses a third-party solution (Lever, Inc.) to administer the recruitment processes online. You can find information about how Lever, Inc. processes your personal informationÂ .

Retention of recruitment records

If your application is successful, we will move your recruitment information to your employment files. We will only move data that is relevant to your ongoing employment at Relic. Once you are employed at Relic, your personal data is governed in accordance with the staff privacy policy and, if applicable, your employment contract. Where you are recruited as a temporary agency worker, we will only process your personal data in relation to the agency work and/or services you provide for Relic.

If your application is unsuccessful, application documentation will be kept on file for twenty-four (24) months from your application date, so that Relic may contact you in respect of future vacancies that may be of interest to you. Relic will also retain your personal data as needed to comply with any legal or document retention obligations.

If you do not wish for Relic and/or Lever to continue to process your personal data in the ways described in this Notice, you can request this through a dedicated link available through Lever platform, or by contacting us in writing at Â .

Once your personal data is no longer needed, we will dispose of your records in a secure manner and in accordance with our records management policies.

Your rights

You have certain rights in relation to the personal data that we hold about you. If you wish to exercise your right to access, update, erase and/or correct personal data which you have submitted to Relic as part of the recruitment process, you can request this through the Lever platform. We will comply with your request(s) as soon as reasonably practicable, consistent with applicable law. Note, in limited cases where permitted, we may charge a fee for data access requests.

If you have any further questions, please contact: Data Protection Officer, Relic Entertainment Inc., 27 Great West Road, Brentford, Middlesex, TW8 9BW or at Â .

If you remain unhappy with a response you receive from us, you can also refer the matter to your data protection supervisory authority:Â
